mackerel.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
mackerel.author: Daniel B.

mackerel.review: Afterwards we got Hokke (grilled mackerel) and the Four seasons roll
mackerel.author: Douglas Y.

mackerel.review: The mackerel tasted good and went well with the ponzu sauce it came with
mackerel.author: Douglas Y.

mackerel.review: Fried and grilled seafood include not only staples like hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail cheek) and takoyaki (fried octopus balls), but dishes like shishamo (willow leaf fish), fried aji (horse mackerel), and asari yaki (sauteed short neck clams)
mackerel.author: Daniel B.

mackerel.review: The version I tried came with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, shrimp, conch, surf clam, red snapper, and mackerel
mackerel.author: Daniel B.

mackerel.review: For example, the ankimo and the mackerel box sushi tasted fine, but it wasn't the best I've had
mackerel.author: Jang C.

mackerel.review: Sashimi:* Shima Aji - yellow jack* Otoro - bluefin fattiest tuna* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper* Maguro - fresh tuna* Kurage - jellyfish* Aji - horse mackerel* Kaibashira - sea scallops* Madai - Japanese red snapper* Uni - sea urchin (two kinds, Hokkaido and Canadian)4
mackerel.author: Daniel B.

mackerel.review: For nigiri I had the very fatty tuna, which is a can't miss, eel, mackerel, snapper, and tuna

mackerel.review: I even tried the usually fishy mackerel, and it was less fishy and tastier than usual
mackerel.author: Kaung S.

mackerel.review: We love sushi and ordered a lot of Nigri -Big eye Tuna, Aji (horse mackerel), Red Snapper, Flounder and rolls - Tuna, Yellowtail, Spicy Tuna

mackerel.review: It was only 6:30 PM and they ran out of horse mackerel and big eye tuna

mackerel.review: In the bento box, she got two pieces of mackerel and maybe 6 pieces of fried squid
mackerel.author: Tiff H.

mackerel.review: I like to get assorted nigiri and prefer the egg omelet (tamago), striped bass, albacore tuna, fresh salmon, white tuna, mackerel (saba), smelt roe (masago), octopus (tako), tuna (maguro), yellowtail, eel (unagi), scallop, uni, and toro

mackerel.review: I am not a big mackerel fan unless it's steeped in salt and made into a mackerel prosciutto (a real thing at another well-known sushi/sashimi establishment around town) or just grilled

mackerel.review: We ordered  O-toro, Hamachi, Wagyu beef (OMG  - it is so good), Ocean trout, Ama ebi (sweet shrimp), toro maki, yellow tail, flounder, shima aji (horse mackerel) fresh wasabi and hampachi (amberjack)

madai carpaccio.review: We had several different dishes, among which the crunch lobster box (very very delicious), the spicy tuna box, the madai carpaccio (fresh and excellent mix of flavours), edamame and several nigiri

madai carpaccio.review: Of the non-sushi items I've tried, I recommend the oysters (crispy, delicate), eggs Benedict (bite-size, scrumptious), ceviche (fresh, tangy), and madai carpaccio (flavorful)

kampachi.review: I would have to say this was the best kampachi I've had in a very long time

sushi.review: At dinner, most non-sushi dishes range in price from $10-25 each
sushi.author: Daniel B.

sushi.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
sushi.author: Daniel B.

sushi.review: Of the non-sushi items I've tried, I recommend the oysters (crispy, delicate), eggs Benedict (bite-size, scrumptious), ceviche (fresh, tangy), and madai carpaccio (flavorful)

sushi.review: Umi is the best sushi I have had in Atlanta, Georgia, the US, and ex-US

The soup to start off with was simple but yummy!The sushi was very flavorful; I definitely recommend both of the sushi that we ordered, and try adding cream cheese to your California Tempura! The soup to start off with was simple but yummy!The sushi was very flavorful; I definitely recommend both of the sushi that we ordered, and try adding cream cheese to your California Tempura! It's delicious!! The fried rice was pretty good too, but I wouldn't get it again

tai.review: EXPLOSION ROLLsushi rice pressed with mixture of spicy salmon, tuna and yellowtail slight seared topped with tempura crunch, masago, tobiko and scallions
tai.author: Debby L.

tai.review: Specialty Cocktails, check
tai.author: Krista S.

tai.review: The Brady Roll is a massive roll- perfect if you're looking for variety it's served 2 ways (a sort of play on sweet and spicy) I loved it!They only offer 1 Ramen version (and I love my Ramen!) and they nail the version that they serve- I got the spicy chili oil on the side and gave mine an extra kick! Also a large a portioned dish!The specialty cocktails are sophisticated and delicious! Their bartender made me something he thought I'd like based on our conversation
tai.author: Krista S.

tai.review: Windmill roll is certainly tasty but the winner winner sit goes to explosion roll
tai.author: Annie L.

tai.review: Tonight it featured UNAGI (eel), SAKE (salmon), WALU (escolar), HIRAME (flounder), KAMPACHI (baby yellowtail), and one other one that I didn't try
tai.author: Jason Y.

tai.review: This was a PRESSED rice roll with spicy salmon, tuna, yellowtail with a bunch of stuff, tempura, masago, tobiko and scallions
tai.author: Jason Y.

tai.review: Another roll we got was the Brady Roll, this was two different rolls focused on spicy yellowtail, with one dressed with spicy tuna/mango puree and another with eel
tai.author: Jason Y.

tai.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: The little details do not go unnoticed
tai.author: Kristina P.

tai.review: I've probably tried the entire menu by now, my favorites: Starters: Spicy Tuna TartareYellowtail JalapenoOtoro TartareUni TempuraSashimi:HamachiMadaiShiromiShima-AjiOtoro (personal favorite)MaguroHot dishes:Rock shrimp tempuraLobster Toban-Yaki (PHENOMENAL) Rolls:American Tuna roll (spicy - :) ) Lobster Tempura rollSpicy tuna roll Kamakazi
tai.author: Guillermo R.

tai.review: Highlights on the menu:Yellowtail jalapeño**Spicy tuna crispy riceOtoro tartareSpicy rock shrimp**Foie gras (to die for)Black codChilean sea bassAssorted sashimi and nigiriAbsolutely all of the SouSaku nigiri**I personally wouldn't recommend getting a sushi roll because I think you get to appreciate the quality of the fish itself by just doing the nigiri and sashimi
tai.author: Mb V.

tai.review: Certainly a great Japanese restaurant, Umi surprised me with a couple of their dishes, their sashimi was some of the freshest I have tasted in the USA
tai.author: Clinton L.

tai.review: I do think it makes a difference when you get served by the main chef, because I feel the main chef gives a more detailed explanation to the dishes served
tai.author: Clinton L.

tai.review: Mine was lacking in details of what was served which was a bummer to me
tai.author: Clinton L.

tai.review: Must try Lisa Ito's creation too! Just look at my pictures and you will want it!There is valet parking downstairs
tai.author: Clinton L.

tai.review: For this last visit we ordered the sea weed salad and the yellowtail appetizers
tai.author: Poupie B.

tai.review: They were both amaxing but the yellowtail is a must have!!! Also ordered the lobster box roll that was super delish
tai.author: Poupie B.

tai.review: I got the "sabor del amor"  which is now one of my favorite cocktails
tai.author: Sasha O.

tai.review: Take the stairs up and Umi is straight ahead
tai.author: Teresa ..

tai.review: The otoro caviar is something I would recommend everyone to order! We also enjoyed the yellowtail carpaccio and crispy spicy tuna appetizers
tai.author: Teresa ..

tai.review: " Trivial detail aside, did I mention this is my favorite Japanese restaurant right now?!?Their ramen definitely hits the spot with its classic chasiu, nori, and soft boiled egg toppings
tai.author: Samantha H.

tai.review: I think it needed to have more substance as well, but it was certainly tasty
tai.author: Erin K.

tai.review: I've had the spicy tuna and yellowtail rolls a few times
tai.author: Randy T.

tai.review: We started with the sashimi three (2x each of salmon tuna and yellowtail), agedashi tofu and mochi, and takoyaki
tai.author: Douglas Y.

tai.review: My roll had salmon, tuna, unagi, and (I think) yellowtail, all of which I like, but the taste, while not bad, wasn't remarkable
tai.author: Mary F.

tai.review: When they bring it to the table, they torch the top as you watch, which is novel and entertaining
tai.author: Mary F.

tai.review: Most plea give a pint size container but this is just ridiculous
tai.author: Teresa ..

tai.review: We had the best sushi I have ever eaten!  It was the picante roll with yellow tail, salmon, cilantro, jalapeño
tai.author: Susan C.

tai.review: Chef David is the absolute best!Yellowtail shots, Omakase sashimi, Chanel Replica Roll, any Uni dish, Matcha Brûlée
tai.author: Jenny L.

tai.review: Service is incredible , attention to detail with culinary execution is second to none!  I sat at the bar to witness the creations and these people are professionals !  Each dish has its own unique presentation and flare!!  Don't forget the flavors:  I ordered the Tallspin cocktail - amazing with a little kick
tai.author: Joe V.

tai.review: Overall I really enjoyed myself but I think the prices were just too high; for two cocktails and ten individual pieces of nigiri we spent $70 (with tip)
tai.author: Lexi W.

tai.review: You can tell so much detail and thought was put into every dish
tai.author: Jenny C.

tai.review: My favorite dish there is probably the Yellowtail shots
tai.author: Ruchira R.

tai.review: We got the volcano roll rich was super creamy (idk this seems the best word to describe it) and the picante roll which was an awesome mix of jalepeno and cilantro and yellowtail
tai.author: Arian Z.

tai.review: We shared a few items off the sushi menu: *the yellowtail jalapeño shots - banging flavor, tangy, and fun to eat*the spicy tuna on the rocks - I LOVED the crunch texture of the rice ball, a ton of tuna (it's only 4 pieces, but each piece is huge)*the double decker - delicious is all I can say*the haven roll - similar to what I know as the "Florida Roll" back home, simple, fresh, yummyAll the fish was obviously VERY fresh
tai.author: Rania G.

tai.review: We loved the mules, dishes, glassware, yellowtail shots, and matcha creme brule
tai.author: Kelly G.

tai.review: It offers a variety of small plates, signature sushi rolls, and handcrafted cocktails
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: COCKTAILSI've been here twice so far and the food and service have been great! Their handcrafted cocktails are really good, especially the Green Rock
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: APPETIZERA notable appetizer is the Yellowtail Jalapeno Shots
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: This dish comes with 6 shot glasses with a slice of yellowtail, cilantro, sriracha, radish, balsamic, and honey yuzu
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: -- Picante which comes with mild spicy yellowtail, cucumber, cilantro, fresh yellowtail, salmon, jalapeno, and yuzu sauce
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: This is the roll version of the yellowtail jalapeno shots
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: -- Yami Yami is a flash fried roll which comes with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, avacado, and cream cheese
tai.author: Belinda L.

tai.review: The waitress was super nice and handy, she def knows a lot details about the menu
tai.author: Sidong H.

tai.review: To start, we got the signature Yellowtail Jalapeno Shots, once it got to the table, "Wow!" from all of us -- such an eye catchy!~ also a great flavor blossom in the mouth!Then we had 3 different sushi rolls, Lady in Red, UN(big portion, so satisfied), Sex & the City
tai.author: Sidong H.

tai.review: Will certainly return!
tai.author: TaNesha M.

tai.review: For $15, you can get 5 small plates and a cocktail
tai.author: Randy T.

tai.review: There are well-maintained private rooms in the back of the restaurant, where you can dine on the floor with a large group
tai.author: Randy T.

tai.review: My five small plates were the fried calamari, the beef kushiyaki (skewers), the salad with salmon skin, a spicy yellowtail roll, and a spicy tuna roll
tai.author: Randy T.

tai.review: Chuck who was our chef for the night entertained us with jokes and some of the tricks he learned while training for the position to navigate the hibachi grill
tai.author: Mercedes W.

tai.review: It's really hard to beat the happy hour deal of $15 for FIVE (small) plates and a cocktail (even if I don't drink)
tai.author: Thi T.

tai.review: Spicy yellowtail roll
tai.author: Thi T.

tai.review: I sipped on the cocktails and both tasted like medicine to my amateur drinking taste buds
tai.author: Thi T.

tai.review: Recently, I was craving some ramen and decided to check out Ginya Izakaya, which is located in the small retail complex at the corner of Northside Dr and Bellemeade Ave (where Cardamom Hill used to be)
tai.author: Jahmin L.

tai.review: I'm not in an extreme rush to go back, but it's certainly an option in the future
tai.author: Annie L.

tai.review: Ginya Izakaya is a Japanese restaurant that opened September 2015 at Berkeley Heights, the apartment/retail complex at Northside Dr and I-75
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: Fried and grilled seafood include not only staples like hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail cheek) and takoyaki (fried octopus balls), but dishes like shishamo (willow leaf fish), fried aji (horse mackerel), and asari yaki (sauteed short neck clams)
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: The version I tried came with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, shrimp, conch, surf clam, red snapper, and mackerel
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: Tuna tartare - $8 - An ingredient from this is not on the menu I believe, but our server did advise us that it contains nuts
tai.author: Paul K.

tai.review: They ship off the ramen with the broth and noodles in the same container, though, so you will want to eat it soon after leaving the restaurant so the noodles don't soak up all the broth
tai.author: Lindsay E.

tai.review: The yellow tail sashimi was my favorite
tai.author: Anna J.

tai.review: Lunch orders to-go come with hot miso soup and a container of soy sauce
tai.author: Vyvy T.

tai.review: Each platter came with pieces of (I took notes on this, don't laugh): toro, red snapper, albacore, squid, snow crab, surf clam, tuna, salmon, grouper, another red snapper, yellowtail, and striped bass
tai.author: Silvie C.

tai.review: My Roll was Hawaiian with tuna and yellow tail
tai.author: Kseniya C.

tai.review: We were given the menu and were told the bar upstairs has a great view of the skyline but a more limited menu
tai.author: Sean L.

tai.review: So I was glad we chose the sushi bar instead of going upstairs
tai.author: Sean L.

tai.review: Having just been told the menu downstairs has more to offer, I was expecting a lot of option
tai.author: Sean L.

tai.review: I particularly enjoyed the upstairs bar area
tai.author: Annie L.

tai.review: It's a good spot to hang out while you wait for your table downstairs I suppose
tai.author: Han L.

tai.review: I really appreciate the mocktail selections
tai.author: Han L.

tai.review: I can't recall the name of the mocktail I ordered, and it's not listed on their online menu, but it had mint and lychee syrup
tai.author: Han L.

tai.review: The thing about the upstairs is it has a limited menu
tai.author: Han L.

tai.review: (There is a separate bar upstairs
tai.author: Mary F.

tai.review: Also, the GM Maria recommended the Hamachi Carpaccio (after we'd ordered the smokey sake, though), and that also probably would've been a better way to go for what I had in mind, since I also love yellowtail
tai.author: Mary F.

tai.review: For cocktails, I had the Smooth Sailor first (involves gin, kiwi, lemongrass), which was fine, but since I didn't want to have three cocktails total, I did end up wishing I'd started with the Afterglow (rum, carrot, ginger, turmeric syrup) which I hadn't initially noticed
tai.author: Mary F.

tai.review: My husband had a campari & OJ (his go to cocktail), so fyi if you're a campari fan, they have it!Finally, yesterday was his birthday & today our wedding anniversary, which we'd mentioned, so when I asked to see the dessert menu, our server (Alleena, who is fantastic! Love her!) said, "Give me a moment
tai.author: Mary F.

tai.review: Perhaps she was expecting to get a bit more detail about certain dishes/fishes etc
tai.author: Mary Margaret B.

tai.review: I also ended up with two long fish bones in two separate bites! Yikes! We also ordered an assortment of nigiri and sashimi, bonito- salmon belly- yellowtail belly-tuna-etc
tai.author: Mary Margaret B.

tai.review: I appreciate good quality sashimi and I certainly didn't feel like I was eating leftovers
tai.author: Lauren A.

tai.review: Be forewarned though that the menu upstairs is limited compared to the interior, and staff control the music so ambiance might change from day to day
tai.author: Lexi W.

tai.review: SUSHI ROLLS- Baja California ($14): spicy tuna, cucumber, cilantro, yellow tail, avocado, jalapeno and sriracha ailoi
tai.author: Lexi W.

tai.review: - Over the Rainbow ($15): shiso sushi rice, spicy tuna, cucumber, avocado, tuna, salmon, shrimp, yellow tail
tai.author: Lexi W.

tai.review: Let's get all the negatives out of the way: ~ the self-park/valet lot is ridiculously annoying because of its odd layout; I'm not sure if you can even self-park during dinner hours ~ O-Ku is not visible from Howell Mill so just turn in where Tom+Chee is~ turning left into Ironworks takes awhile because Howell Mill traffic is horrible ~ there were such long waits between courses for omakase (chef's choice tasting menu); over 2 hours to get our food even when the restaurant was pretty much empty (we had a late dinner bc of our group size) - this made the whole dinner a little unpleasantO-Ku Omakase - because this is a chef's choice menu, the items vary so I won't go into much details about exactly what we got
tai.author: Kim N.

tai.review: Nice outside upper deck for cocktails or lite bite
tai.author: Meagan G.

tai.review: There are different types of seating arrangements up stairs, from bar side, to 2 seaters, 4 seaters, and even couches
tai.author: Thi T.

tai.review: After hearing specific examples of the different dishes served at each omakase level, I thought the higher level omakase was worth it (and in hindsight, it certainly was)
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: Nigiri:* Creme de la Creme - otoro, truffle shavings, caviar* Hiramasa - lightly cured yellowtail, cilantro, jalapeno, herb oil, ponzu* Marmalade - red snapper, shiso leaf, sweet citrus* Kani Truffle - crab meat, truffle butter, pesto* Otoro Uni ^ - fattiest tuna with sea urchin, aburi-style* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper, aburi-style* Yakiniku Wagyu - seared wagyu beef with BBQ sauce, scallion7
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: Apps (scallop, yellowtail carpaccio, smoked salmon) were all tasty
tai.author: Jennifer H.

tai.review: Yellowtail slices were stingy thin, not the "proper" thin like a few other comparable Japanese restaurants
tai.author: Jennifer H.

tai.review: The upstairs dining area had an amazing view of the Atl skyline with a nice lounging area
tai.author: Desiree T.

tai.review: Cons: The view is basically what you pay for if you decide on dining upstairs
tai.author: Desiree T.

tai.review: The wait was quoted for us at an hour and a half for only 3 people downstairs but as I look around most tables were reserved for ones with a reservation
tai.author: Desiree T.

tai.review: We went upstairs to the first come first serve area and figured it'll be faster to find a seat at least somewhere
tai.author: Desiree T.

tai.review: Menu has limited options upstairs and has very few selections of food but plenty of drink options
tai.author: Desiree T.

tai.review: I typically only get one signature cocktail but I got two of these because I enjoyed it so much
tai.author: Lindsay B.

tai.review: Located in the high ended shoppes of Buckhead this place is most certainly worth a visit
tai.author: Arlene M.

tai.review: Yellow tail carpacio is very good
tai.author: Robbie A.

tai.review: Meticulously planned decor has been so many fine details, it's just breathtaking
tai.author: Praveen R.

tai.review: why have I not eaten this cut of Salmon before! And why is this is thing is not popular in America! At at $6, it's a MUST TRY!***Grilled Yellow tail cheek or Hamachi Kama was not as good as Salmon cheek & belly, but as good(or better) as from any other top end Japanese restaurant
tai.author: Praveen R.

tai.review: ***Omakase Nigiri - I am not going to say much than it was good and they serve 8 pieces of usual cuts like salmon, tuna, yellow tail, octopus and such
tai.author: Praveen R.

tai.review: ***Drinks - they have many cocktails, imported sake and local beers as well
tai.author: Praveen R.

tai.review: They only take reservation during a certain time of day so pay attention to the phone recording when you call
tai.author: Hannah W.

tai.review: replete with all the attention to detail this culinary experience demands
tai.author: Foodie Buddha F.

tai.review: You could have guessed by their attention to detail
tai.author: Chlo L.

tai.review: The sushi was so fresh you didn't have to chew it!!! My favorite was the young yellow tail appetizer!!
tai.author: Crystal B.

tai.review: That certainly makes me feel better about the roots of the poor experience - though does nothing to remove the poor value for money we experienced
tai.author: Bruce P.

tai.review: While the previous restaurant was not "modern" it had a certain "Japanese" feel
tai.author: Bruce P.

tai.review: We love sushi and ordered a lot of Nigri -Big eye Tuna, Aji (horse mackerel), Red Snapper, Flounder and rolls - Tuna, Yellowtail, Spicy Tuna
tai.author: Madurai G.

tai.review: I know certain places increase the thickness of batter and decrease the thickness of meat for their tonkatsu to save money but Sushi Huku was not one of them
tai.author: Jin K.

tai.review: Comes with 3 shrimp, de-tailed and mushrooms
tai.author: Misty S.

tai.review: Also got the spicy shrimp roll which was very fresh, and a couple of cocktails from the bar which were great
tai.author: Misha A.

tai.review: Shrimp, white fish, tuna, salmon and yellow tail and then chunks of sashimi
tai.author: Eddie R.

tai.review: One of the better places to get sushi in Atlanta, also good calamari and cocktails
tai.author: Amy W.

tai.review: :-(  Stained paper menus left from previous party were eventually replaced with new ones and 3rd glass of water finally arrived
tai.author: Allicia S.

tai.review: Good food and awesome crowd for a Friday nightWe sat at the bar and ordered several apps and sampled some of the cocktailsI had the seafood pancake, large pieces of fresh squid and a really tasty mayo and soy drizzled over - different and good!The only draft here is Asahi Japanese beer- a light lager Seaweed salad - good choice for the appThey are pretty crowded on Friday, so get there early, free parking to the right of the building
tai.author: Kate F.

tai.review: I ordered a couple pieces of Yellowtail Nigiri, The Shoyu Tamago and the Dan Dan Ramen
tai.author: Azim D.

tai.review: You can order bento boxes which are box-shaped containers with different compartments filled with various foods
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: For example, one bento box may contain salad, sushi, a spring roll, rice or noodles, and teriyaki chicken
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: I like to get assorted nigiri and prefer the egg omelet (tamago), striped bass, albacore tuna, fresh salmon, white tuna, mackerel (saba), smelt roe (masago), octopus (tako), tuna (maguro), yellowtail, eel (unagi), scallop, uni, and toro
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: Masago nigiri contains tiny little bright orange fish eggs
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: It consists of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, avocado, cucumber, tobiko, and a soybean "seaweed" wrap
tai.author: Daniel B.

tai.review: I ordered the Mountain Samurai roll
tai.author: John S.

tai.review: Sometimes I'll go the yellowtail route but I'm not always in the mood for it
tai.author: Mary Margaret B.

tai.review: For $40 this class was a steal! We had a blast learning all the techniques and tricks to making sushi like pros and were treated to apps, cocktails, and deliciously fresh sushi during the course of the class
tai.author: Meagan N.

tai.review: Staff was friendly, funny, and great at keeping us entertained
tai.author: Meagan N.

tai.review: I held out hope for the cocktails, since I read online that they were potent
tai.author: Candyce V.

tai.review: Our server didn't seem very intent on being pleasant with us, though we didn't give her a hard time about the grease-dripping Big Ass Egg Roll or my lack of even a hint of a buzz from the cocktails I tried
tai.author: Candyce V.

tai.review: Living in "the burbs", we don't often make it ITP, but this cute little hipster spot has some incredible offerings, and awesome cocktails, and a terrific staff
tai.author: Alley H.

tai.review: I mean Fantastic specialty cocktails and sushi! Best I've had in Atlanta thus far! The atmosphere is colorful, fun, playful, nerdy and little sexy! Bar is rad and overall decorum
tai.author: Macey M.

tai.review: This was certainly a disappointment
tai.author: Josee M.

tai.review: Kampachi (yellowtail in ponzu sauce with serrano peppers on top) - This dish is always one of my top faves
tai.author: Esther K.

tai.review: Yellowtail was buttery and slightly firm and the ponzu sauce had an even balance of yuzu to lighten the flavor
tai.author: Esther K.

tai.review: I believe it was sea bream with freshly grated wasabi with some soy sauce, otoro with a jalapeno on top, and a lime zest and juice poured yellowtail
tai.author: Esther K.

tai.review: Small nigiri platter #2 - All nigiri were torched (and this is like a big thing now in Korea and my friends have been raving about "fire nigiri sushi") and it went from amaebi or sweet shrimp with a fried shrimp head, torched yellowtail with lemon slice, and torched wagyu beef with scallions
tai.author: Esther K.

tai.review: Mister raved about the yellowtail
tai.author: Esther K.

tai.review: Yellowtail-delicious appetizerJellyfish- I loved the crunchy texture of it
tai.author: Amanda N.

tai.review: We ordered  O-toro, Hamachi, Wagyu beef (OMG  - it is so good), Ocean trout, Ama ebi (sweet shrimp), toro maki, yellow tail, flounder, shima aji (horse mackerel) fresh wasabi and hampachi (amberjack)
tai.author: Madurai G.

tai.review: -sushi rice was cooked to perfection: not overly sticky, not undercooked-good amount of wasabi underneath each piece of nigiri: I can't stand the "generous" portions of wasabi that certain places use because it overwhelms the flavor of the fish and throws off the balance between fish and sushi rice
tai.author: Vera L.

tai.review: Other things to expect based on our initial experience: cocktails coming out after the appetizers (ugh), good-tasting cocktails, a dish you've already finished appearing again (ugh), long delays between dishes (ugh), someone else's dish arriving at your table (ugh), and a bill that you have to send back because they've charged you for the correct items and incorrect quantities, which, according to my calculations, gets them more money if you don't happen to notice (ugh)
tai.author: Cameron H.

tai.review: Our nigiri was wonderful, too: yellowtail and smoked salmon were buttery and fresh
tai.author: Will P.

tai.review: I tried to signature cocktail that evening, which happened to be a pear tree martini
tai.author: Mitchell F.

tai.review: Their cocktails were cute and tasted good
tai.author: Shelaya L.

tai.review: Sat at the sushi bar (best place to sit, in my opinion) and had a good meal with entertaining and friendly sushi chefs
tai.author: Parenty L.

tai.review: Their cocktail list looked good, but we didn't try any of them
tai.author: Taylor A.

tai.review: Our server was good, but didn't seem to have the best grip on what was in certain items
tai.author: Zewditu D.

tai.review: Awesome sushi and good cocktails
tai.author: C F.

tai.review: I did not expect the to enjoy the cocktails as much as I did
tai.author: C F.

domestic beer.review: I counted over 150 dishes on the main menu; nearly 30 different types of nigiri and 40 rolls on the sushi menu; and a decent variety of Japanese beers, sakes, and plum wines to go along with domestic beer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages including Japanese uncarbonated soft drinks like Calpico
domestic beer.author: Daniel B.

takoyaki.review: They have sushi/sashimi, typical/specialty rolls, common appetizers like agadashi tofu, takoyaki or edamame, udon noodle or ramen, tempura, and other entrée dishes
takoyaki.author: Douglas Y.

takoyaki.review: We started with the sashimi three (2x each of salmon tuna and yellowtail), agedashi tofu and mochi, and takoyaki
takoyaki.author: Douglas Y.

takoyaki.review: The takoyaki was on point!! Crispy outside, soft, almost runny on the inside
takoyaki.author: Douglas Y.

takoyaki.review: I've had takoyaki when I visited Tokyo last year and these matched the quality
takoyaki.author: Douglas Y.

takoyaki.review: My other favorites are the okonomiyaki, ika geso karaage, hamachi kama, and takoyaki
takoyaki.author: Vyvy T.

takoyaki.review: I definitely recommend the okonomiyaki or takoyaki
takoyaki.author: Jane H.

takoyaki.review: Fried and grilled seafood include not only staples like hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail cheek) and takoyaki (fried octopus balls), but dishes like shishamo (willow leaf fish), fried aji (horse mackerel), and asari yaki (sauteed short neck clams)
takoyaki.author: Daniel B.

egg.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
egg.author: Daniel B.

egg.review: Of the non-sushi items I've tried, I recommend the oysters (crispy, delicate), eggs Benedict (bite-size, scrumptious), ceviche (fresh, tangy), and madai carpaccio (flavorful)

toro.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
toro.author: Daniel B.

toro.review: My favorite is the buttery sake toro
toro.author: Daniel B.

toro.review: Other memorables: otoro (melts in your mouth), hotate (from Hokkaido, succulent), saba (I like its different texture/flavor), ikura (clean, briny taste), and uni (creamy)
toro.author: Daniel B.

toro.review: Saki aioli (salmon and caviar) and the otoro caviar are MELT IN YOUR mouth--eat as is and don't dip in soy sauce
toro.author: Nisreen S.

toro.review: I've probably tried the entire menu by now, my favorites: Starters: Spicy Tuna TartareYellowtail JalapenoOtoro TartareUni TempuraSashimi:HamachiMadaiShiromiShima-AjiOtoro (personal favorite)MaguroHot dishes:Rock shrimp tempuraLobster Toban-Yaki (PHENOMENAL) Rolls:American Tuna roll (spicy - :) ) Lobster Tempura rollSpicy tuna roll Kamakazi
toro.author: Guillermo R.

toro.review: Highlights on the menu:Yellowtail jalapeño**Spicy tuna crispy riceOtoro tartareSpicy rock shrimp**Foie gras (to die for)Black codChilean sea bassAssorted sashimi and nigiriAbsolutely all of the SouSaku nigiri**I personally wouldn't recommend getting a sushi roll because I think you get to appreciate the quality of the fish itself by just doing the nigiri and sashimi

toro.review: The otoro caviar is something I would recommend everyone to order! We also enjoyed the yellowtail carpaccio and crispy spicy tuna appetizers

omakase.review: Let's get all the negatives out of the way: ~ the self-park/valet lot is ridiculously annoying because of its odd layout; I'm not sure if you can even self-park during dinner hours ~ O-Ku is not visible from Howell Mill so just turn in where Tom+Chee is~ turning left into Ironworks takes awhile because Howell Mill traffic is horrible ~ there were such long waits between courses for omakase (chef's choice tasting menu); over 2 hours to get our food even when the restaurant was pretty much empty (we had a late dinner bc of our group size) - this made the whole dinner a little unpleasantO-Ku Omakase - because this is a chef's choice menu, the items vary so I won't go into much details about exactly what we got

aji.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
aji.author: Daniel B.

aji.review: Fried and grilled seafood include not only staples like hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail cheek) and takoyaki (fried octopus balls), but dishes like shishamo (willow leaf fish), fried aji (horse mackerel), and asari yaki (sauteed short neck clams)
aji.author: Daniel B.

aji.review: We ordered  O-toro, Hamachi, Wagyu beef (OMG  - it is so good), Ocean trout, Ama ebi (sweet shrimp), toro maki, yellow tail, flounder, shima aji (horse mackerel) fresh wasabi and hampachi (amberjack)

yellowtail.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here

yellowtail.review: We got the volcano roll rich was super creamy (idk this seems the best word to describe it) and the picante roll which was an awesome mix of jalepeno and cilantro and yellowtail
yellowtail.author: Arian Z.

yellowtail.review: We shared a few items off the sushi menu: *the yellowtail jalapeño shots - banging flavor, tangy, and fun to eat*the spicy tuna on the rocks - I LOVED the crunch texture of the rice ball, a ton of tuna (it's only 4 pieces, but each piece is huge)*the double decker - delicious is all I can say*the haven roll - similar to what I know as the "Florida Roll" back home, simple, fresh, yummyAll the fish was obviously VERY fresh
yellowtail.author: Rania G.

yellowtail.review: We loved the mules, dishes, glassware, yellowtail shots, and matcha creme brule
yellowtail.author: Kelly G.

yellowtail.review: This dish comes with 6 shot glasses with a slice of yellowtail, cilantro, sriracha, radish, balsamic, and honey yuzu
yellowtail.author: Belinda L.

yellowtail.review: -- Picante which comes with mild spicy yellowtail, cucumber, cilantro, fresh yellowtail, salmon, jalapeno, and yuzu sauce
yellowtail.author: Belinda L.

yellowtail.review: This is the roll version of the yellowtail jalapeno shots
yellowtail.author: Belinda L.

yellowtail.review: -- Yami Yami is a flash fried roll which comes with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, avacado, and cream cheese
yellowtail.author: Belinda L.

yellowtail.review: My five small plates were the fried calamari, the beef kushiyaki (skewers), the salad with salmon skin, a spicy yellowtail roll, and a spicy tuna roll
yellowtail.author: Randy T.

yellowtail.review: Spicy yellowtail roll
yellowtail.author: Thi T.

yellowtail.review: Fried and grilled seafood include not only staples like hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail cheek) and takoyaki (fried octopus balls), but dishes like shishamo (willow leaf fish), fried aji (horse mackerel), and asari yaki (sauteed short neck clams)
yellowtail.author: Daniel B.

yellowtail.review: The version I tried came with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, shrimp, conch, surf clam, red snapper, and mackerel
yellowtail.author: Daniel B.

yellowtail.review: Each platter came with pieces of (I took notes on this, don't laugh): toro, red snapper, albacore, squid, snow crab, surf clam, tuna, salmon, grouper, another red snapper, yellowtail, and striped bass
yellowtail.author: Silvie C.

yellowtail.review: Also, the GM Maria recommended the Hamachi Carpaccio (after we'd ordered the smokey sake, though), and that also probably would've been a better way to go for what I had in mind, since I also love yellowtail
yellowtail.author: Mary F.

yellowtail.review: I also ended up with two long fish bones in two separate bites! Yikes! We also ordered an assortment of nigiri and sashimi, bonito- salmon belly- yellowtail belly-tuna-etc
yellowtail.author: Mary Margaret B.

yellowtail.review: Nigiri:* Creme de la Creme - otoro, truffle shavings, caviar* Hiramasa - lightly cured yellowtail, cilantro, jalapeno, herb oil, ponzu* Marmalade - red snapper, shiso leaf, sweet citrus* Kani Truffle - crab meat, truffle butter, pesto* Otoro Uni ^ - fattiest tuna with sea urchin, aburi-style* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper, aburi-style* Yakiniku Wagyu - seared wagyu beef with BBQ sauce, scallion7
yellowtail.author: Daniel B.

yellowtail.review: Apps (scallop, yellowtail carpaccio, smoked salmon) were all tasty
yellowtail.author: Jennifer H.

yellowtail.review: I like to get assorted nigiri and prefer the egg omelet (tamago), striped bass, albacore tuna, fresh salmon, white tuna, mackerel (saba), smelt roe (masago), octopus (tako), tuna (maguro), yellowtail, eel (unagi), scallop, uni, and toro
yellowtail.author: Daniel B.

yellowtail.review: It consists of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, avocado, cucumber, tobiko, and a soybean "seaweed" wrap

yellowtail.review: Sometimes I'll go the yellowtail route but I'm not always in the mood for it

yellowtail.review: Kampachi (yellowtail in ponzu sauce with serrano peppers on top) - This dish is always one of my top faves

yellowtail.review: I believe it was sea bream with freshly grated wasabi with some soy sauce, otoro with a jalapeno on top, and a lime zest and juice poured yellowtail

yellowtail.review: Small nigiri platter #2 - All nigiri were torched (and this is like a big thing now in Korea and my friends have been raving about "fire nigiri sushi") and it went from amaebi or sweet shrimp with a fried shrimp head, torched yellowtail with lemon slice, and torched wagyu beef with scallions

yellowtail.review: Mister raved about the yellowtail

yellowtail.review: Our nigiri was wonderful, too: yellowtail and smoked salmon were buttery and fresh

garlic.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
garlic.author: Daniel B.

miso.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
miso.author: Daniel B.

ginger.review: I had the volcano which was dry, they brought out the ginger salad which was atleast one day old - not fresh
ginger.author: JJ_Surgi_Rep

ginger.review: Christmas dinner at Bua, we decided to check this place out after being next door (noche) all the time, we have a taste for Thai and sushi, my wife loved the (ginger)margarita and I loved the Japanese beer, my baby loved the miso soup and then it was time for the rolls! we usually go for the most exotic and
ginger.author: FERNANDO C

ginger.review: The ginger salad dressing was white and creamy
ginger.author: Bob S

ginger.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
ginger.author: Daniel B.

ginger.review: It's not served in the traditional copper mug but they shave fresh ginger in it which really makes it stand out
ginger.author: Mb V.

ginger.review: The good qualities is the salad was organic lettuce with fresh ginger dressing
ginger.author: Stephanie G.

ginger.review: The salad was a great complement to the other 4 dishes - the salmon skin was served in crispy strips and came with a tasty ginger dressing
ginger.author: Randy T.

ginger.review: The ginger dressing is separate so you are in control of how much you put in your salad
ginger.author: Thi T.

ginger.review: The chunks of liver are served conveniently sliced, beautifully presented with minced scallion, beni shoga (pickled red ginger), sprouts, a bit of seaweed, and plenty of ponzu
ginger.author: Daniel B.

ginger.review: The salad had ginger dressing which was a plus and the highlight of the meal
ginger.author: Robbie G.

ginger.review: For cocktails, I had the Smooth Sailor first (involves gin, kiwi, lemongrass), which was fine, but since I didn't want to have three cocktails total, I did end up wishing I'd started with the Afterglow (rum, carrot, ginger, turmeric syrup) which I hadn't initially noticed
ginger.author: Mary F.

ginger.review: At Doraku, they serve with grated ginger, wasabi, chopped green onions, thinly sliced dried seaweed and a green tea dashi(Stock)
ginger.author: Praveen R.

ginger.review: Miso Soup and salad with ginger dressing were both notable!  Soup was hot, fresh
ginger.author: Russell P.

ginger.review: Greens in salad were some of the best I've seen in awhile and the ginger dressing was OUTSTANDING!  Sashimi was delicious
ginger.author: Russell P.

ginger.review: Not to mention that a TON of ginger had been dumped in the bowls, which really overpowered all the other flavors anyway
ginger.author: Allyson T.

ginger.review: Soup was very flavorful and the salad has a nice light house made ginger dressing
ginger.author: Arman S.

ginger.review: First of all, I found a bug at the bottom of my ginger salad
ginger.author: Lauren R.

ginger.review: -chu-toro nigiri: medium grade fatty-tuna, also flown in from Japan and orderedMiso soup and a side salad with ginger dressing was served as well, complimentary from the house

ginger.review: The salad is greens in dressing; however we didn't get iceberg with neon pinkish orange ginger dressing we received fresh spring greens with a house made almost like a spicy mustard vinaigrette

wakame.review: ---------Tako SunomonoPROS-great flavor and balance of the mirin and the rice vinegar-tako (octopus) was not overcooked, tender and not rubbery-served with equal or slightly less amount of thin sliced cucumbers and a little bit of wakame, giving a nice variety of texture

juice.review:
chicken was juice but needed more seasoning
smoked salmon Benedict: average

tamago.review: I like to get assorted nigiri and prefer the egg omelet (tamago), striped bass, albacore tuna, fresh salmon, white tuna, mackerel (saba), smelt roe (masago), octopus (tako), tuna (maguro), yellowtail, eel (unagi), scallop, uni, and toro

soft drinks.review: I counted over 150 dishes on the main menu; nearly 30 different types of nigiri and 40 rolls on the sushi menu; and a decent variety of Japanese beers, sakes, and plum wines to go along with domestic beer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages including Japanese uncarbonated soft drinks like Calpico

baby beet salad.review:
Typically, whether dining as a couple or a group, we order 1 dip and several meze, followed by a fish or two (depending on the weight) 
Meze that we like the most:
-spanakopita
-spicy lamb pie
-octopus
-baby beet salad
-scallops (not on the menu this last visit)
General advice:
-The cocktails are good

salmon.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
salmon.author: Daniel B.

salmon.review: Saki aioli (salmon and caviar) and the otoro caviar are MELT IN YOUR mouth--eat as is and don't dip in soy sauce
salmon.author: Nisreen S.

salmon.review: Both the teriyaki chicken and teriyaki salmon are reasonably moist and well seasoned

cucumber roll.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
cucumber roll.author: Daniel B.

cucumber roll.author: Amanda B.

calamari.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
calamari.author: Daniel B.

calamari.review: My five small plates were the fried calamari, the beef kushiyaki (skewers), the salad with salmon skin, a spicy yellowtail roll, and a spicy tuna roll
calamari.author: Randy T.

calamari.review: I was pleasantly surprised to find that the calamari came in large pieces and was lightly breaded
calamari.author: Randy T.

calamari.review: Served with fried vegetables, the calamari was tender - not seasoned a lot, but it came with a dipping sauce

ika.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
ika.author: Daniel B.

ika.review: My other favorites are the okonomiyaki, ika geso karaage, hamachi kama, and takoyaki
ika.author: Vyvy T.

ika.review: Also they use expensive 'Akari Koshihikari' rice for nigiri
ika.author: Praveen R.

ika.review: My friend and I ordered shrimp tempura udon noodle appetizer, the kenchin-mushi (steamed eel wrapped tofu and vegetables), ika kimo shouyu (grilled squid marinated squid liver soy sauce), and lobster box sushi
ika.author: Hannah W.

ika.review: Some of my favorite orders here are angel fish roll with brown rice, salmon, ika (squid), raw scallop, ebi (sweet shrimp) and their fantastic "uni ravioli" app

uni.review: I advise against the raw uni, as it may cause you upset stomach like it did to me and my dad

uni.review: I have tried their drinks ranging from Thai tea, to cucumber martinis, to their rice wine! All having unique taste and flavor and none a disappointment!Validated parking is available in the back for five bucks, which they will deduct from your overall bill

uni.review: They did not have uni and scallop was disappointing as they don't have raw scallop
uni.author: Kseniya C.

uni.review: The best deals are on the $4 uni (sea urchin), toro (fatty tuna), and ama ebi (shrimp with head)

uni.review: I like to get assorted nigiri and prefer the egg omelet (tamago), striped bass, albacore tuna, fresh salmon, white tuna, mackerel (saba), smelt roe (masago), octopus (tako), tuna (maguro), yellowtail, eel (unagi), scallop, uni, and toro
uni.author: Daniel B.

uni.review: The uni and toro are good, but I can notice a difference in quality between them and their more expensive counterparts at a higher-end or more authentic sushi restaurant
uni.author: Daniel B.

uni.review: The uni, in particular, tastes slightly more fishy
uni.author: Daniel B.

uni.review: The only impressive thing was the Kampachi that hit every note of our tastes buds from citrus to salty- very unique tasting and the Black Lava drink, refreshing with a kick of thai chili
uni.author: Jane D.

uni.review: The highlights, however, came last with the unique Uni (Sea Urchin) and the 24-piece Tuna Nigiri Progression (from Maguro to Churoro to Toro to the super fatty Otoro)
uni.author: Al M.

uni.review: For my drinks I always get the same thing - their lychee martinis are that good! We also ordered salmon tartare for the appetizer, spicy tuna roll, squid, ikura, and uni nigiri
uni.author: Kseniya C.

uni.review: -uni nigiri: the waitress told me that the uni was flown in from Japan that day and so it had to be ordered
uni.author: Vera L.

uni.review: -balanced portion of fish to rice ratioCONS-NONE---------Uni (sea urchin): I'm comparing this to the uni from Sushi Yasuda which was so creamy and fresh that it literally dissolved in my mouth
uni.author: Vera L.

uni.review: Thank you Japan for letting us fly it in!PROS-the most melt-in-your-mouth you can find in ATL (to date for me)-no fermented fish flavor: most important part to me-great portion of uni, definitely not stingy with the seafood today!-probably the second best uni nigiri that I've had in the USA, but I've yet to order it out west so this will be put to the test in April when I go out to the Bay!CONS- super expensive for two pieces of nigiri
uni.author: Vera L.

uni.review: The uni that I received wasn't even fresh
uni.author: Nhan M.

uni.review: My father had ordered an assortment of the higher end sushi (ameba, uni, toro) and they piled it on a plate and gave it to the wrong person
uni.author: michael c.

uni.review: Have you ever heard of a serious artist having a substitute work on his behalf? I have of a few actually ;-) The food was a 10+ course meal made up of some exotic and unique courses and some perfectly prepared traditional sushi courses
uni.author: Zaher E.

uni.review: And yes they are unique
uni.author: Matthew Nan C.

scallop.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
scallop.author: Daniel B.

scallop.review: I had everything from o toro to Uni to live scallops to wagu
scallop.author: Jenny C.

scallop.review: I was really satisfied with all of the rolls I tried: -- The Chanel Replic which comes with scallop tempura, mango, fresh scallop, tuna, scallions, red tobiko, soy chili sauce, and creamy wasabi

nigiri.review: Over two dozen types of nigiri are offered which is a decent selection

nigiri.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
nigiri.author: Daniel B.

nigiri.review: Presentation is outstanding from the illuminated bowls of ice that serve as the base for the nigiri boards to small touches like the pipette of yuzu in the ceviche
nigiri.author: Daniel B.

nigiri.review: I don't need my hamachi kama with balsamic vinaigrette or my nigiri with truffle sea salt
nigiri.author: Daniel B.

nigiri.review: All of the nigiri is good
nigiri.author: Daniel B.

nigiri.review: I received it as part of the chef's choice nigiri platter

nigiri.review: Highlights on the menu:Yellowtail jalapeño**Spicy tuna crispy riceOtoro tartareSpicy rock shrimp**Foie gras (to die for)Black codChilean sea bassAssorted sashimi and nigiriAbsolutely all of the SouSaku nigiri**I personally wouldn't recommend getting a sushi roll because I think you get to appreciate the quality of the fish itself by just doing the nigiri and sashimi
nigiri.author: Mb V.

nigiri.review: Standout dishes:Hokkaido Uni, super freshFoie Gras topped with wasabi dressing and gold flakesBlack Miso Cod, the only hot dish in my Itokase, recommended by my waitressWagyu beef nigiriSeared Scallop nigiriSalmon topped with mayo and caviar nigiriGREEN TEA ICE CREAM!!!! what a way to end the meal

nigiri.review: There's a nigiri and sashimi moriawase for $35 (chef's choice 12 pieces of nigiri or 6 pieces nigiri and 6 pieces sashimi); a 21-piece nigiri omakase with misoshiru (tofu, wakame, scallions) for $90; and two levels of omakase (chef's choice dinner): one priced at $75 and another at $100

nigiri.review: Ordered a few appetizers, rolls and nigiri

nigiri.review: -uni nigiri: the waitress told me that the uni was flown in from Japan that day and so it had to be ordered

nigiri.review: -sushi rice was cooked to perfection: not overly sticky, not undercooked-good amount of wasabi underneath each piece of nigiri: I can't stand the "generous" portions of wasabi that certain places use because it overwhelms the flavor of the fish and throws off the balance between fish and sushi rice
nigiri.author: Vera L.

nigiri.review: Thank you Japan for letting us fly it in!PROS-the most melt-in-your-mouth you can find in ATL (to date for me)-no fermented fish flavor: most important part to me-great portion of uni, definitely not stingy with the seafood today!-probably the second best uni nigiri that I've had in the USA, but I've yet to order it out west so this will be put to the test in April when I go out to the Bay!CONS- super expensive for two pieces of nigiri
nigiri.author: Vera L.

nigiri.review: --------Chu-toro nigiri: This was again, also flown in from Japan, and I ordered it only because they did not have O-Toro, the fattiest grade of tuna possible

sea urchin.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
sea urchin.author: Daniel B.

sea urchin.review: " Among the more unique options, there's toro (fatty tuna), snow crab, ikura (salmon roe), and uni (sea urchin)
sea urchin.author: Daniel B.

sea urchin.review: - Otoro Spoons ($25): five dainty spoons filled with a bite-sized serving of otoro tartare in a garlic ponzu sauce, accompanied by a tiny taste of uni (sea urchin) and topped with black caviar and wasabi stem
sea urchin.author: Lexi W.

sea urchin.review: The sushi bar had not one, but two types of uni (sea urchin) the night we went

sea urchin.review: Sashimi:* Shima Aji - yellow jack* Otoro - bluefin fattiest tuna* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper* Maguro - fresh tuna* Kurage - jellyfish* Aji - horse mackerel* Kaibashira - sea scallops* Madai - Japanese red snapper* Uni - sea urchin (two kinds, Hokkaido and Canadian)4
sea urchin.author: Daniel B.

sea urchin.review: Nigiri:* Creme de la Creme - otoro, truffle shavings, caviar* Hiramasa - lightly cured yellowtail, cilantro, jalapeno, herb oil, ponzu* Marmalade - red snapper, shiso leaf, sweet citrus* Kani Truffle - crab meat, truffle butter, pesto* Otoro Uni ^ - fattiest tuna with sea urchin, aburi-style* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper, aburi-style* Yakiniku Wagyu - seared wagyu beef with BBQ sauce, scallion7
sea urchin.author: Daniel B.

cucumber.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
cucumber.author: Daniel B.

cucumber.review: -- Picante which comes with mild spicy yellowtail, cucumber, cilantro, fresh yellowtail, salmon, jalapeno, and yuzu sauce
cucumber.author: Belinda L.
