tuna.review: This was a PRESSED rice roll with spicy salmon, tuna, yellowtail with a bunch of stuff, tempura, masago, tobiko and scallions
tuna.author: Jason Y.

tuna.review: Another roll we got was the Brady Roll, this was two different rolls focused on spicy yellowtail, with one dressed with spicy tuna/mango puree and another with eel
tuna.author: Jason Y.

tuna.review: I wasn't too hungry but still wanted a few pieces so I went fancy and got the Bin Fin Chutoro or the medium fatty tuna
tuna.author: Jason Y.

tuna.review: The richness of the caviar didn't overdo the fattiness of the tuna and with a little of the fresh wasabi, it was perfect
tuna.author: Jason Y.

tuna.review: Started off with the tuna tart crisps, tartar and hamachi
tuna.author: Sim N.

tuna.review: This includes madai (Japanese snapper), bincho maguro (albacore tuna), and three different cuts of blue fin maguro (blue fin tuna) including chutoro (medium fatty cut) and otoro (fattiest cut)
tuna.author: Daniel B.

tuna.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
tuna.author: Daniel B.

tuna.review: A few of my favorites: Spicy tuna crispy rice starter, very lightly fried and the tuna is extremely flavorful
tuna.author: Nisreen S.

tuna.review: I've probably tried the entire menu by now, my favorites: Starters: Spicy Tuna TartareYellowtail JalapenoOtoro TartareUni TempuraSashimi:HamachiMadaiShiromiShima-AjiOtoro (personal favorite)MaguroHot dishes:Rock shrimp tempuraLobster Toban-Yaki (PHENOMENAL) Rolls:American Tuna roll (spicy - :) ) Lobster Tempura rollSpicy tuna roll Kamakazi
tuna.author: Guillermo R.

tuna.review: The crispy spicy tuna alone is worthy of all 5 stars
tuna.author: Pawanpreet G.

tuna.review: Highlights on the menu:Yellowtail jalapeño**Spicy tuna crispy riceOtoro tartareSpicy rock shrimp**Foie gras (to die for)Black codChilean sea bassAssorted sashimi and nigiriAbsolutely all of the SouSaku nigiri**I personally wouldn't recommend getting a sushi roll because I think you get to appreciate the quality of the fish itself by just doing the nigiri and sashimi
tuna.author: Mb V.

tuna.review: To start, my family and I ordered two orders of the spicy tuna sticky rice appetizers
tuna.author: Brooke K.

tuna.review: All of the rolls with tuna were my favorite! I typically don't like tempura rolls and I loved those too
tuna.author: Brooke K.

tuna.review: Our entire meal was delicious, from the tuna salad, to sushi, to entree, to dessert
tuna.author: Sasha O.

tuna.review: The otoro caviar is something I would recommend everyone to order! We also enjoyed the yellowtail carpaccio and crispy spicy tuna appetizers
tuna.author: Teresa ..

tuna.review: I've had the spicy tuna and yellowtail rolls a few times
tuna.author: Randy T.

tuna.review: We started with the sashimi three (2x each of salmon tuna and yellowtail), agedashi tofu and mochi, and takoyaki
tuna.author: Douglas Y.

tuna.review: My roll had salmon, tuna, unagi, and (I think) yellowtail, all of which I like, but the taste, while not bad, wasn't remarkable
tuna.author: Mary F.

tuna.review: The sashimi three comes with 2 pieces of tuna, salmon, & white tuna each so it's good to share between two people
tuna.author: Hannah W.

tuna.review: Ordered the sushi deluxe and tuna was not very fresh in the tuna roll
tuna.author: Teresa ..

tuna.review: However I did not find the menu all that inventive unfortunately
tuna.author: James S.

tuna.review: The jalapeño tuna shooters were admittedly fantastic and a "must" for any visit
tuna.author: James S.

tuna.review: It literally was one of the best things I've ever tasted - spicy tuna , but savory at the same time !   Total check $49
tuna.author: Joe V.

tuna.review: skip and get another rollI've tried the following rolls so far:OMG roll: spicy tuna, salmon, avocado, crab mixSex and the City roll: my favorite roll, light and fresh with tuna and avocadoTwilight roll:spicy tuna with albacore
tuna.author: D.J. K.

tuna.review: We shared a few items off the sushi menu: *the yellowtail jalapeño shots - banging flavor, tangy, and fun to eat*the spicy tuna on the rocks - I LOVED the crunch texture of the rice ball, a ton of tuna (it's only 4 pieces, but each piece is huge)*the double decker - delicious is all I can say*the haven roll - similar to what I know as the "Florida Roll" back home, simple, fresh, yummyAll the fish was obviously VERY fresh
tuna.author: Rania G.

tuna.review: I was really satisfied with all of the rolls I tried: -- The Chanel Replic which comes with scallop tempura, mango, fresh scallop, tuna, scallions, red tobiko, soy chili sauce, and creamy wasabi
tuna.author: Belinda L.

tuna.review: -- Yami Yami is a flash fried roll which comes with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, avacado, and cream cheese

tuna.review: My five small plates were the fried calamari, the beef kushiyaki (skewers), the salad with salmon skin, a spicy yellowtail roll, and a spicy tuna roll

tuna.review: We all shared the spicy tuna roll -- NOTE: if you check in on Yelp, you get a BOGO sushi roll!  We were all very satisfied with our meals

tuna.review: Seared white tuna
tuna.author: Thi T.

tuna.review: Everything was great! The chirashi comes out super pretty and there's two pieces of almost everything (eel, salmon, tuna, egg, etc

tuna.review: We opted for the following: spicy tuna roll (was pretty standard but still fresh), grilled shishito peppers (had a good char on them), wasabi pork shumai (had a kick to them, tender and flavorful), and the spicy tonkotsu ramen (outstanding--great spicy flavor)

tuna.review: -Tuna tartare: small portion, great presentation, tuna mixed with peanuts and other delicious things

tuna.review: " Among the more unique options, there's toro (fatty tuna), snow crab, ikura (salmon roe), and uni (sea urchin)

tuna.review: The version I tried came with tuna, salmon, yellowtail, shrimp, conch, surf clam, red snapper, and mackerel

tuna.review: Hard to tell as the tuna and any seasoning masked the minced pieces

tuna.review: It's a little odd just due to the nuts texture wise I feel, in between the slices of tuna

tuna.review: We had the volcano, spicy tuna, spider, and dragon roll

tuna.review: The rolls I usually order are the tuna lovers roll and crunch salmon roll

tuna.review: Then came out the moriwase platter and unfortunately lost both of us

tuna.review: My Roll was Hawaiian with tuna and yellow tail

tuna.review: Sashimi:* Shima Aji - yellow jack* Otoro - bluefin fattiest tuna* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper* Maguro - fresh tuna* Kurage - jellyfish* Aji - horse mackerel* Kaibashira - sea scallops* Madai - Japanese red snapper* Uni - sea urchin (two kinds, Hokkaido and Canadian)4

tuna.review: But likewise the fish slices were stingy and scarcely thing! Also, several rolls were all based on "spicy tuna", lacking variety

tuna.review: Unfortunately those days appear to be gone

tuna.review: I patronize a lot of authentic Japanese sushi places and I also eat a lot of just Americanized sushi because, hell, who doesn't love spicy tuna rolls? So I know to set the bar for delivery sushi (which I've had some fantastic stuff delivered prior in the area) and this, this was probably on the lowest rung of just the worst sushi I've had

tuna.review: I remember one of the rolls being SO spicy that I couldn't eat more than one but unfortunately I cant remember which one it was

eel.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
eel.author: Daniel B.

eel.review: It's a perfect pairing with dessertPrice: You will spend a pretty penny here (~$80/per person to feel adequately full), but if you love food, and love sushi, it will be the best money you've spent! A few areas of improvement: Service

spicy tuna.review: Here's what I've tried:Non-sushi items:* Hamachi Kama - grilled yellowtail cheekbone with balsamic vinaigrette and ponzu served alongside hajikami* Moshi Moshi Oyster - lightly battered oysters, Japanese tartar sauce* Calamari Ringlets - crispy calamari, wasabi infused mayo, sweet soy reduction drizzle* Eggs Benedict - bed of rice, spicy tuna, shiso leaf, sunny side up quail egg* Ceviche - ocean trout, tomatoes, sweet red onion, avocado, yuzu dressing* Madai Carpaccio - thinly shaved Japanese snapper, splash of truffle oil, tonzazu reductionSushi (nigiri unless otherwise noted):* Red Samurai Roll - spicy tuna & cucumber rolled with layers of avocado, fresh tuna, grape tomato & serrano pepper dipped in ponzu* Blue Fin Otoro (fattiest tuna) - gold flakes, caviar* Kampachi (baby yellowtail) - jalapeno* Walu (escolar) - miso glaze, garlic chip* Hamachi (yellowtail) - red jalapeno salsa, black lava salt* Hotate (sea scallops) - seared, yuzu citrus wasabi, spicy caviar* Shima Aji (mackerel/yellowtail cross) - jalapeno sauce* Sake Toro (salmon belly) - tonzazu sauce, capers, truffle sea salt* Hirame (flounder) - shiso leaf, shio konbu* Maguro (tuna) - big eye tuna, sesame oil, fried leeks* Saba (mackerel) - lightly seared, yuzu soy, lemon juice, ginger, scallion* Unagi (eel) - sweet soy reduction, sesame seed* Uni (sea urchin) - seared, kizami wasabi* Ikura (salmon roe) - house marinatedGenerally, I've enjoyed everything I've had here
spicy tuna.author: Daniel B.

spicy tuna.review: The crispy spicy tuna alone is worthy of all 5 stars
spicy tuna.author: Pawanpreet G.

So I know to set the bar for delivery sushi (which I've had some fantastic stuff delivered prior in the area) and this, this was probably on the lowest rung of just the worst sushi I've had

red snapper.review: Sashimi:* Shima Aji - yellow jack* Otoro - bluefin fattiest tuna* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper* Maguro - fresh tuna* Kurage - jellyfish* Aji - horse mackerel* Kaibashira - sea scallops* Madai - Japanese red snapper* Uni - sea urchin (two kinds, Hokkaido and Canadian)4
red snapper.author: Daniel B.

red snapper.review: Nigiri:* Creme de la Creme - otoro, truffle shavings, caviar* Hiramasa - lightly cured yellowtail, cilantro, jalapeno, herb oil, ponzu* Marmalade - red snapper, shiso leaf, sweet citrus* Kani Truffle - crab meat, truffle butter, pesto* Otoro Uni ^ - fattiest tuna with sea urchin, aburi-style* Kinmedai - golden eye snapper, aburi-style* Yakiniku Wagyu - seared wagyu beef with BBQ sauce, scallion7
red snapper.author: Daniel B.
